reference.title: required-cleanup
reference.shortdesc: A <required-cleanup> element is used as a placeholder for migrated elements that cannot be appropriately tagged without manual intervention. As the element name implies, the intent for authors is to clean up the contained material and eventually remove the <required-cleanup> element. Authors should not insert this element into documents.

ul.li: Processors must strip this element from output by default. The content of <required-cleanup> is not considered to be verified data.
Processor options may be provided to allow a draft view of migrated content in context.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.title: Example
example.p: Presuming an original HTML document had contained some content within a <center> tag (for which there is no clear migrational equivalent in DITA), the following might be the result that is valid within an XML editor, but which requires an author to decide how to better tag or revise this original content:
example.codeblock: <section> <title>Some section title</title> <required-cleanup remap="center">Some original content migrated from a <center> tag.</required-cleanup> </section>
